content: https://xentoshiblocks.com/+==============+XENtoshi Blocks - SEED+==============+The First-Ever Original Game on Bitcoin Ordinals.Every piece of this game is a NFT.Follow the Inscription Id (xxxxxx) anyway...Puzzles are waiting for you..."A buried secret waits, its truth unknown."*⸜( •ᴗ• )⸝*---------------------------------------------[LET'S GO!] -> https://ordinals.com/content/580dfe4e84878e690c7b151d8bd7238f1fa0edebac58278a768278711121cf03i0Recommend the official site of https://ordinals.com for the best text rendering, audio listening, and gaming experience.Tips: If the text rendering or picture is too small, please open the 'content link' of the inscription to see the original raw information.Game Development Info-----------------------------------Story Design: Twine (https://twinery.org/) is an open-source tool for telling interactive, nonlinear stories.Puzzle Design: ASCII Texts/Arts"XENtoshi Blocks - SEED" is the first part of this series, and there are more than 10+ puzzles embedded in this game. Gamers need to try their best to crack all the puzzles and find the deeper secret.The puzzles in this game cover a wide range of topics, including but not limited to:• Sherlock Holmes references• Hexadecimal cryptography• Binary cryptography• MD5 cryptography• Morse code cryptography• Physics• Mazes• SudokuAny feedback is welcome, and it could help me to develop further parts of this series better.Cheers,

comments.body: day 2 passed, and 700+ players in total have tried [XENtoshi Blocks].feedback is welcome, too hard or too easy?The game tells the story of a programmer named XENtoshi, who one day suddenly receives an email with a mysterious map. He follows the map, cracking various puzzles along the way, and helps his friends recover a 12-word seed and passphrase to restore the Taproot wallet, regaining the unique and extremely rare Xunicorn Ordinals NFT. The puzzles in this game cover a wide range of topics, including but not limited to:• Sherlock Holmes references• Hexadecimal cryptography• Binary cryptography• MD5 cryptography• Morse code cryptography• Physics• Mazes• Sudoku

comments.body: It makes me so happy to see people exploring what is possible with Ordinals like this. I can’t wait to see what other stuff people are able to come up with.
